definition_en: Sacred ash produced from the perpetual fire (Dhuni) lit by Sai Baba, known for its healing powers.
definition_es: Ceniza sagrada producida del fuego perpetuo (Dhuni) encendido por Sai Baba, conocida por sus poderes curativos.

definition_en: Unwavering faith and trust in the Guru not just in good times but through all trials.
definition_es: Fe inquebrantable y confianza en el Gurú, no solo en los buenos tiempos sino a través de todas las pruebas.

definition_en: Patience and courage to wait for the Guru's grace without losing heart.
definition_es: Paciencia y coraje para esperar la gracia del Gurú sin desanimarse.

definition_en: The practice of constant remembrance and chanting of the Divine Name.
definition_es: La práctica del recuerdo constante y el canto del Nombre Divino.

definition_en: The nine forms of devotion: Shravanam (Hearing), Kirtanam (Singing), Smaranam (Remembering), Padasevanam (Serving Feet), Archanam (Worshipping), Vandanam (Bowing), Dasyam (Servitude), Sakhyam (Friendship), Atmanivedanam (Surrender).
definition_es: Las nueve formas de devoción: Shravanam, Kirtanam, Smaranam, Padasevanam, Archanam, Vandanam, Dasyam, Sakhyam, Atmanivedanam.

definition_en: The three Goddesses: Lakshmi (Wealth/Will), Saraswati (Knowledge), and Kali (Power/Action).
definition_es: Las tres diosas: Lakshmi (Riqueza/Voluntad), Saraswati (Conocimiento) y Kali (Poder/Acción).

definition_en: The path of selfless action, performing one's duty without attachment to the fruit of action.
definition_es: El camino de la acción desinteresada, cumpliendo con el deber sin apego al fruto de la acción.

definition_en: The Ultimate Reality or Cosmic Spirit in Hindu philosophy.
definition_es: La Realidad Última o Espíritu Cósmico en la filosofía hindú.

definition_en: Divine play or sport of the Incarnation, often referring to the stories of their life.
definition_es: Juego divino o deporte de la Encarnación, a menudo refiriéndose a las historias de su vida.

definition_en: A story or discourse that imparts spiritual knowledge or moral teaching.
definition_es: Una historia o discurso que imparte conocimiento espiritual o enseñanza moral.

definition_en: The temple where Sai Baba's body is interred and worshipped.
definition_es: El templo donde está enterrado y venerado el cuerpo de Sai Baba.

definition_en: The dilapidated mosque where Sai Baba lived for 60 years, which he called the 'Mother of Mercy'.
definition_es: La mezquita en ruinas donde Sai Baba vivió durante 60 años, a la que llamó 'Madre de la Misericordia'.

definition_en: The village meeting place where Baba slept on alternate nights.
definition_es: El lugar de reunión del pueblo donde Baba dormía noches alternas.

definition_en: The place under the Neem tree where Baba was first seen as a young yogi.
definition_es: El lugar bajo el árbol de Neem donde Baba fue visto por primera vez como un joven yogui.

definition_en: The garden Baba tended to, where the Nanda Deep (perpetual lamp) burns.
definition_es: El jardín que Baba cuidaba, donde arde el Nanda Deep (lámpara perpetua).

definition_en: Palanquin procession, held every Thursday in Shirdi.
definition_es: Procesión de palanquín, celebrada todos los jueves en Shirdi.

definition_en: The early morning prayer sung to wake up the Lord.
definition_es: La oración de la mañana temprano cantada para despertar al Señor.

definition_en: The night prayer sung before the Lord goes to sleep.
definition_es: La oración nocturna cantada antes de que el Señor se vaya a dormir.

definition_en: Alms begged by a monk; Sai Baba lived by begging food daily.
definition_es: Limosna pedida por un monje; Sai Baba vivía pidiendo comida a diario.

definition_en: Monetary offering given to the Guru, symbolizing surrender of attachment.
definition_es: Ofrenda monetaria dada al Gurú, simbolizando la entrega del apego.

definition_en: An era or epoch in Hindu cosmology (Satya, Treta, Dwapara, Kali).
definition_es: Una era o época en la cosmología hindú (Satya, Treta, Dwapara, Kali).

definition_en: The order of renunciation; but Baba taught inner renunciation over outer attire.
definition_es: La orden de renuncia; pero Baba enseñó la renuncia interior sobre la vestimenta exterior.

definition_en: Sectarian Pride. The arrogance or pride associated with one's own sect or lineage, often becoming a terrifying obstacle on the spiritual path.
Religious Pride. The rigid pride one holds regarding their own religion, believing it to be superior to others, which hinders spiritual progress.
Worship of God with form and attributes (like an idol or a Guru). Sai Baba clarified that one often needs to pass through this to reach the formless state.
Worship of the formless, attributeless God. A higher state of worship often difficult for ordinary humans to grasp without first surrendering to a Guru.

The ninefold path of devotion consisting of Shravana (Listening), Kirtana (Singing), Smarana (Remembering), Padasevana (Service of feet), Archana (Worship), Vandana (Bowing), Dasyam (Servitude), Sakhyam (Friendship), and Atmanivedanam (Self-surrender).
The first step of Nav Vidha Bhakti; listening to the stories and glories of the Lord or the Guru with a pure heart.
Selfless action performed without the desire for fruits or rewards, dedicating the action entirely to the Divine to purify the mind (Chitta Shuddhi).
The path of the bird. A direct, rapid flight to liberation or spiritual ascent, as opposed to the slower path of the ant (Pipilika Marg).
The sacred ash from Baba's Dhuni (perpetual fire), believed to have miraculous healing powers and symbolizing the transient nature of life.
Purification of the mind or heart. A prerequisite for true spiritual knowledge and the grace of the Guru to manifest.
Literally 'oil-presser'. Baba used this term metaphorically to describe 'clingy' devotees who stick to the Guru only for selfish desires.
Literally 'betel leaf seller'. Baba used this term metaphorically for those who hate or reject the Guru after their selfish needs are not met.
A bouquet of hymns/praises. A specific composition by Das Ganu Maharaj in praise of Sai Baba, which Baba held in high regard.
Knowledge of the Absolute (Brahman). The ultimate realization of the self as one with the universe.
The highest form of speech or sound, originating from the deepest level of consciousness, where the chanting becomes effortless.
Pure faith, reverence, and devotion to the Guru and the divine teachings. It is one of the two pillars of Sai Baba's path.
Patient endurance, perseverance, and waiting with hope. It is the second of the two pillars of Sai Baba's path.
The perpetual sacred fire in Dwarkamai maintained by Sai Baba. The ash (Udi) from this fire is distributed to devotees for protection and healing.
The great or final Samadhi; the conscious, voluntary act of a realized soul leaving the physical body, as performed by Sai Baba in 1918.
